Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; from top: two large circles in added white with added red on interior: large red and white dot rosettes between red and white bands; band of lotus buds in white outline with red centres; red and white bands; at bottom of sherd, band of alternating red and white tongues; exterior: alternating thick and thin brown bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p. 14, no. 22-3, pl. 3) (Incorrectly labelled on plate as I48)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1600) (phase 2)
